text:
I am getting error - Update (<mailto:abc2@def.com|abc2@def.com>) and property email addresses (<mailto:abc@def.com|abc@def.com>) must match in /contact/batch API.
Also a correlation Id is given in the API response
Can someone help.

I am working on building a custom card that needs to access a 3rd party api. I am struggling to find documentation on how to actually store and then access the 3rd party API token in this scenario. I am trying to reference some of the example cards that HubSpot have released and the setup doesn’t make all that much sense to me.
It looks like in the “serverless.json” file for the function you include the secret name as shown <https://github.com/HubSpot/ui-extensions-examples/blob/main/with-google-maps/src/app/app.functions/serverless.json|here>.
Then in the actual function, the key is being referenced by `process.env`  as seen in line 92 <https://github.com/HubSpot/ui-extensions-examples/blob/main/with-google-maps/src/app/app.functions/maps.js|here>.
It seems like I need to store the actual value in an env file maybe? Anyone that could provide some clarity on the way to physically do this would be greatly appreciated.
<@U049ZDGRHF0> you can store your secrets using `hs secrets add` command. You need to build and deploy the project again, once you add the secrets to the account
Ok got it. Would `process.env`  be the proper way to access the secret from within the serverless function?
someone has already customized validation of company form fields ?
Hi there, how can I override default HS validation with JS validation ? <#CCQ7H31D5|developer-tools>
Hi, yes, that’s how you access secrets within serverless functions, and you need to pass them inside serverless.json
